Customizing the Palette Bar

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

If you feel limited by the selection of colors on the Palette Bar, you can replace one or more of them with customized colors.

To replace a color on the palette bar with a customized color:

  1. If the Palette Bar is not already displayed, click the Tools button on the Chart window toolbar, and select PaletteBar from the menu.

  2. If the window is not wide enough to display the complete Palette Bar, use the arrows to scroll through the patterns.

  3. Select a color that you wish to replace with a custom color, and double-click. The Color dialog opens.

  4. Click Define custom colors. The Color dialog expands to display all the available colors.

  5. Select a color from the color refiner box of available colors. Variations in brightness for the selected color appear in the luminosity bar to the right.

  6. Move the slider in the luminosity bar to change the color in the Color/Solid box. Information about the selected color appears in the text boxes beneath the color refiner box.

  7. When you finish defining the custom color, click OK. The new color replaces the original palette bar color.

  8. To compare a few hues side-by-side,

    1. Click Add to custom colors again.

    2. Repeat steps 5 and 6 until you have several colors defined in the Custom colors boxes.

    3. Select one of the custom colors, then click OK. The new color replaces the original palette bar color.
